meanings.definition: Of or relating to a deity or other being conceived of as having the form of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The ancient statue had a zoomorphic design, depicting a god with the head of a lion.
meanings.sent2: The zoomorphic carvings on the temple walls showcased various animal forms.
meanings.sent3: The zoomorphic figurine of a cat with wings brought a smile to the archaeologist's face.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry box had a zoomorphic shape, resembling a graceful swan.
meanings.sent5: The zoomorphic painting of a dragon was so lifelike that it seemed ready to leap off the canvas.

meanings.definition: Representing gods or animals in the form of animals.
meanings.sent1: The zoomorphic sculptures in the museum displayed intricate details of animal deities.
meanings.sent2: In zoomorphic art, the gods were often depicted with animal features.
meanings.sent3: The zoomorphic tapestry showed a playful scene of animal gods having a picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace had a zoomorphic charm shaped like a tiny elephant.
meanings.sent5: The zoomorphic illustrations in the book made the mythical creatures come alive.

meanings.definition: Having the form of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The zoomorphic mask worn by the dancer transformed her into a graceful gazelle.
meanings.sent2: The zoomorphic patterns on the fabric resembled a herd of running horses.
meanings.sent3: The zoomorphic cake decoration featured a cute bunny made of frosting.
meanings.sent4: His zoomorphic backpack had ears and a tail, making him look like a playful puppy.
meanings.sent5: The zoomorphic clouds in the sky seemed to take the shape of a giant bear.
